required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Microfracture at Proximal Humerus Lateral to Footprint Could Enhance the Rotator Cuff Healing
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Patients Treated With and Without Lateralized Microfracture During Rotator Cuff Repair

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this clinical trial is to test whether there is any effect on rotator cuff healing by making microfracture at the lateral side of the footprint. The main question it aims to answer are:
- [whether the lateralized microfracture could decrease the retear rate after arthroscopy rotator cuff repair.]
- [whether the lateralized microfracture could improve the functional recovery after arthroscopy rotator cuff repair.] Participants with medium to larger size rotator cuff tears will be randomly assigned to the study group treated with lateralized microfracture immediately after arthroscopy rotator cuff repair or the control group treated with conventional arthroscopy rotator cuff repair without microfracture.

primary_outcome.description: The scans were evaluated for rotator cuff integrity and degree of re-tears (no re-tears, partial or complete re-tear) by an independent radiologist

secondary_outcome.measure: Active range of motion of Shoulder
secondary_outcome.description: Active forward flexion, abduction and external rotation will be measured with a manual goniometer at the preoperative visit, 3 months and 24 months after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Passive range of motion of Shoulder
secondary_outcome.description: Passive forward flexion, abduction and external rotation will be measured with a manual goniometer at the preoperative visit, 3 months and 24 months after surgery.

American Shoulder and Elbow scores (minimum 0 points, maximum 100 points, higher values are considered better outcomes) of patients with rotator cuff tears treated with and without lateralized microfracture at the preoperative visit, 3 months and 24 months after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: University at California at Los Angeles Shouder Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: University at California at Los Angeles Shoulder Rating Scale(minimum 3 points, maximum 35 points, higher values are considered better outcomes) of patients with rotator cuff tears treated with and without lateralized microfracture at the preoperative visit, 3 months and 24 months after surgery.

Visual Analog Scale for Pain(minimum 0 points, maximum 10 points, higher values are considered worse outcomes) of patients with rotator cuff tears treated with and without lateralized microfracture at the preoperative visit, 3 months, and 24 months after surgery.

arm_group.description: Participants with medium to larger size rotator cuff tears will be treated with arthroscopy rotator cuff repair with microfracture at the lateral side of the footprint immediately.
Participants with medium to larger size rotator cuff tears will be treated with arthroscopy rotator cuff repair without microfracture.

intervention.description: making microfracture(4 holes with 2mm diameter) at the lateral side of the footprint right after arthroscopy rotator repair.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Medium to large Rotator cuff tear(1cm-5cm) diagnosed by MRI
2. Patients can complete the follow-up and comply with all post-operative rehab instructions
3. Failure of non-operative treatment for at least 3 months
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Revision rotator cuff surgery
2. Partial thickness rotator cuff tears
3. Small (less than 1cm) and Massive (greater than 5cm) rotator cuff tears
4. Disease history of the affected shoulder
5. Systemic immune diseases
6. Irreparable rotator cuff tear
